div.l: Ill hail Alayn̄ / bi god thou is a fonne
This sely Clerkys / han fast y ronne
Towarde the fen / both Aleyn̄ and eek Iohn
And whanne the myller͗e / sawh that they wer gon
He half a busshell / of her flour / hath take
And bad his wyf go knede it in a kake
And seid y trowe / the clerkes wer a ferde
Yit can a myller / make a clerkys berde
For all her art / yit lat hem gon her way
Lo wher thei gon / yea lat the childre play
Thei gete him nouht / so lyhtly bi my crowne
Thes sely clerkys / rennyn vp and downe
Wyth kepe kepe stand stand Io Ia · and warderere
Ga whistil thou / and I sal kepe hem here
But shortly / til it was verray nyht
They cowde nat / thouh they dedyn̄ al ther myht
He capil cache / he ran alway so fast
Tyl in a dyche / they cauht him at the last
Wery and weet as beeste is in the reyn̄
Cometh seely Iohn / and wᵗyth him cometh Aleyn̄
Allas ꝙquod Iohn the day / that y was borne
Now ar we dryven / to ethyn and to scorne
Our corne is stole / men wol vs fooles calle
Bothe the wardeyn̄ / and our felaus alle
And namely the myller͗e / weleaway
Thus pleyneth Iohn / as he goth bi the day day way
Towarde the mylle / and bayard on hond
The myller by the fyer syttyng he fond
For it was nyht / and ferther myht they noht
But for the love of god / they him bisouht
